repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Development of the State
            Statistics System for Monitoring the Social and Economic
            Transformation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome rating of the
            Development of the State Statistics System for Monitoring
            the Social and Economic Transformation Project for Ukraine
            was judged to be satisfactory. The Bank and borrower
            performance were satisfactory. The risk to development
            outcome was moderate. Several lessons were learned.
            Statistical capacity building requires integrated and
            coordinated support that could take a long-term commitment.
            Ownership and commitment by the Bank project team, as
            evidenced by the continuity and close engagement, was
            another factor that helped successful completion of the
            project. Initially, the project procurement plan included a
            large number of small procurement packages. The project team
            discussed with the borrower to bundle similar items into one
            large contract and made necessary adjustments in the
            procurement plan. The project proved that this approach has
            been more cost efficient and time saving. Signing a single
            contract with a consortium regarding the technical
            assistance consulting services was the right choice for such
            complex and comprehensive projects. This mechanism provided
            a one-stop-shop for expertise and technical assistance and
            helped the implementation to be coherent, consistent and in
            a well-sequenced manner. The Bank project team, along with
            the borrower, should make sure that the project funds will
            be included in the budget line for the implementing agency
            so it will not go through the ratification process. In such
            cases for other countries, identifying champions of project
            (statistics) within parliament and/or in key committees and
            by holding talks with key members of the parliament and
            relevant committees could help the ratification process. The
            Bank needs to increase the number of experienced information
            technology procurement specialists. The Bank and client team
            should work closely with relevant procurement specialists
            and design the procurement package in a way that to avoid
            confusion or misspecification in the package.
